website_summaries.verdict: This design provides two layers of protection against escaping air.
pros: Foam and fabric stopper blocks draft on both sides of door
Glides easily over many flooring surfaces
Can be cut to fit narrower doors
Looks good on bottom of the door and stays attached
cons: Might be a little challenging to get the foam tubes inside the fabric sleeve
Consider using a broom to open the sleeve before inserting

customer_reviews.title: Overall good product
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived on time and was as described by the seller. It is very thick and wide so I had to cut it shorter to fit my door length. It has stopped the amount of dirt and dust that enters my house under ge door very well. nly observation is that when the door is opened or closed the product slides slightly out so in order to close the dooor you have to push the thing in place with your foot. Otherwise, I recommend this product, it is sturdy, and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Peña

customer_reviews.title: It's ugly.  It also works.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's ugly, but it beats having a towel down on the floor that you have to reposition all the time. Although it does a good job stopping drafts, it does have a drawback of shifting slightly here, so that the draft stopper will hit the jam, and you need to nudge it back into position with your foot. This doesn't happen too often. Considering the cost (cheap) and the fact that it performs well most of the time, I rate it pretty highly. I did have to cut this to fit the door, and could see the sewing was going to let go very fast at the seams, so I applied duct tape and it's working well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: This sucks so bad I wish I hadn't spent money on this. 30 minutes of my life that I'll never get back. One side, the foam went in with some difficulty, the other side was a nightmare. It's obvious that the stitching was too close & impossible for the foam pieces to fit. The seam split on one side and we tried rubbing a little soap on the foam to help it slide in easily but that didn't work. Since it split at the seam we decided to just open it up halfway, put the foam in & tape it up.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha Hagler

customer_reviews.title: Highly disappointed with this product
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about receiving this product, however after installing it I was extremely disappointed. Although it did help the draft issue underneath my front door. It slides out every time the door opens and closes. Which is truly an inconvenience to ALWAYS have to bend down to push it back into place. The vinyl material is not the best option, it's too slippery and doesn't stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Dulene

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculous waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: My mistake was buying it without realizing that it is bigger than a standard door...I'm flexible and can deal with it...so I cut down to size. Problem solved. However, next issue...not fixable. You'll love it if you don't ever open the door. However for those of us who actually use our doors, this piece of junk slides with every swing of the door so be prepared to have to push it back into place every time you use your door. Since I cut it, no bother in even asking if I can return it. Look elsewhere for a similar product.
customer_reviews.author: Prov31girl

customer_reviews.title: Hideously ugly
customer_reviews.text: These are functional but hideous. They say you can cut them to fit width of door, but this requires to bust out the sewing machine to mend them. They are also meant for unusually wide doors so there’s more tweaking there. They are so ugly! They look cheap! Only thing good is the jumbo foam... which by the way does not interlock with the plastic tubes as directions state. Pictures are not accurate
customer_reviews.author: Lisa D

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for us
customer_reviews.text: We have a pretty large gap under our door, and the occasional bug entering has been an issue. We had hoped this would help, but it simply would not fit under our door. I’m assuming anyone ordering this would have to have a pretty sizable gap under their door for it to fit. Also, ours came with a rip in the seam. We are very sad it didn’t work out. Back to placing the rolled yoga mat in front of the door method.
customer_reviews.author: Jazmin Byrum

customer_reviews.title: Awful
customer_reviews.text: I was happy when I first saw this one. I liked how it was vinyl so that it would be easy to clean, boy was I wrong. It’s terrible. I cut down so it would fit the door. It came completely undone on one side so the piping wouldn’t fit in. It kept getting caught under the door. I had it for 4 days and it’s already in the trash. It also had no elastic or anything to make it stay on the door. I have bought the Duck brand door drafts and they have an elastic to hold it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Faford

customer_reviews.title: really hard time getting the tubes in cause of low quality control
customer_reviews.text: The only thing this offered over the ones the stores here carried was a thicker material which i wanted cause of the location of the door. But thats where it ends, when i first put the tubes in one side they slid in very easily so i was surprised at the reviews that said they struggled. Well then came the other side...i had a hell of a time even getting the tube to start let alone get the entire thing inside. It took me 45 mins to twist, squeeze, bend, etc to get the second side in. Not worth the hassle, get the ones at lowes/homedepto and save yourself the headache
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M Davis

customer_reviews.title: Seals the door perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Great item for under the door wind drafts. I bought this for winter and I have really liked it since I got it. The only one thing I don't like is the material under the stopper. Its all made out of the same material. I have wooden floors and if some dirt gets under the material, when I open the door, I hear the dust dragging on the floor. It has made slight scratches on my floor. I think that it would be good if the material under the stopper would be softer for wooden floors. But other than that the stopper works great and it seals the door very well.
customer_reviews.author: jav818

customer_reviews.title: Nice stoppers
customer_reviews.text: These work great! They are larger than my previous ones and actually do the job. I wish there were other colors though
customer_reviews.author: Jantine Fishell

customer_reviews.title: LOOSE FITTING doesnt hold to door
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great but if your door frame is even 1/4 inch higher than the floor the draft stopper does not flow back and forth if you are opening and closing the door .Great for a seldom used door. As you open and close the door the draft stopper tends to move off the door and you then have to push it back on the door. Also true the foam tubes move in and out as neither end is sealed. After just two days the fabric was ripping at both ends enen though it was cut back 1/2 to 3/4 inch on each end.
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM  WILSON

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Im currently renting and the master bedroom door has a very big gap. Every time I stood on the other side I could feel a very string breeze heat/ac escaping the bedroom, additionally every morning and lot of light would come thru. This product solved all these problems instantly. Be prepared to do some arts and crafts and take measurements. The original size was too big for the door so I had to cut a few inches, which it was super easy to do. Additionally it slides very easily with the door since we have carpet in that area. Overall: im very glad we purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Mark G

customer_reviews.title: CHEAPLY MADE
customer_reviews.text: I GIVE THIS PRODUCT A 1 STAR BECAUSE I CAN NOT GIVE IT ANY LOWER . THE ITEM I RECIEVED LOOKS NOTHING LIKE THE PICTURE SHOWN. IT IS A CHEAP AND POORLY MADE DOOR/DRAFT STOPPER I HAVE EVER SEEN. I WOULD SEND IT BACK BUT IT IS NOT WORTH THE SHIPPING CHARGE. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT SAVE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It worked great. The only downside is that it only works ...
customer_reviews.text: We are renovating our home and we replaced our front door last year. We didn’t get the weather stripping on before winter and had quite a draft. I bought this as a stop-gap measure to get us through winter. It worked great. The only downside is that it only works for the one season. After a single winter it is falling apart. I highly recommend it for a short period of time. But if you need a permanent solution, you’ll need to buy proper weather proofing products.
customer_reviews.author: Appy

customer_reviews.title: Not used for drafts... but for cats.
customer_reviews.text: To start, my cats are chow hounds. They seem to want food with their for and every hour after they eat so.. I purchased this to stop my cats from tearing up the carpet with their claws and to hopefully not hear them when they use their claws to pluck at the bedroom door and meow while begging for food at 3 am. Lucky for me this worked as planned! It’s saving my carpet and allowing me a few extra hours of sleep. I don’t hear their yowls as much and it fits nice and snug against the carpet. Easy to install as well!
customer_reviews.author: MartinaTC

customer_reviews.title: Ripped in 30 seconds
customer_reviews.text: I followed all the instructions and slid it in. Tested it out by opening and closing the door twice and saw the huge RIP at the bottom of the cheap plastic. I guess I could tape the rip or just leave it there but it keeps ripping each time I open and close the door. HUGE WASTE OF MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: V. Dang

customer_reviews.title: They work but could be better
customer_reviews.text: I installed two door draft stoppers on two metal outside doors. The form inserts were difficult to push all the way down in the channel made for them. I installed them under the doors and cut off the excess material. I noticed that they fit rather loosely and can work their way out easily. I have to readjust them with each door opening. Also, I have high thresholds which cause me to have to lift the end of the draft stopper in order to close the door.
customer_reviews.author: donnie

customer_reviews.title: Keeps out noise and odors
customer_reviews.text: Nice tight fit, but slides easily when opening and closing the door. Has never moved out of place and once on the door will not need to be pushed back in place like some of the smaller, cheaper ones. Can use indoors or on an outside door. Wipes clean with a damp paper towel when necessary The larger diameter of this tube compared to others makes all the difference. Not soundproof, but does what it is intended to do. Keeps out noise and odors
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Used for a year and a half, really happy with this product.
customer_reviews.text: I've lived in 2 different houses in the past 1 1/2 years since I bought this. In both houses, it worked perfectly to cover large gaps under interior doors. It even blends in the with the color of wood doors and looks decent. In my current house, the gap under the door is huge-- over an inch-- and the product would sometimes get snagged when the door was opened or closed. I solved the issue by using thumb tacks to attach this product to the bottom of the door. I had to trim it a little to get it to fit, but that was easily done with a sharp knife.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Returned for full refund
customer_reviews.text: What a disappointment. If the Styrofoam tubes would fit inside the vinyl covers I think it could've been awesome. The search for a good draft stopper continues, but I'm reluctant to take anymore risks with any other of these products because they're cheap Chinese garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Fye

customer_reviews.title: Worth it but not sure how long it will hold up.
customer_reviews.text: You really have to cut the foam down in order to fit your door due to how it closes. I ended up having to cut off part of the vinyl and that made the sewn edges come unraveled. I also taped it to keep it in place and not try to slide off every time I try to close the door. It really keeps the drafts out and keeps the noise out from my laundry room. (Vinyl floors in laundry room through kitchen where the door is located)
customer_reviews.author: Rene Warren

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancellation is the sole reason for me having purchased this,...
customer_reviews.text: I live in an old apartment, my neighbors have allowed me to go inside their apartment so I could hear through their door closed how loud my TV sounds (not because its actually loud but because its those cheap non insulated doors) so I decided to purchase this and give it a try. WOW, it decreased the outgoing sound by 80% easily, I could now even have the TV pretty loud and not one complaint from my neighbors. Plus it circulates the air indoors. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Really hard to assemble
customer_reviews.text: It comes with six 12" foam pieces that you are supposed to shove through a sleeve to form the finished product. Then you size it on the door and cut off the excess. I had a lot of trouble getting the foam into the sleeves. They were sewn unevenly - smaller at one end than the other and extremely difficult to get to the end like you were supposed to put them. However, once it was assembled, it was easy to trim off the excess and to get under the door to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is trash
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the reviews. This thing is a piece of trash. Literally. And it is so annoying, I had to duct tape it to the door so that it would not block me half way through trying to open the door. I just ended up throwing it away after a month of it annoyingly getting in the way of the door and the ugliness is already was and added with duct table. This shouldn’t even be sold. Literally a piece of trash
customer_reviews.author: Lara

customer_reviews.title: These are wonderful they look good and flow well with the door
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful they look good and flow well with the door. The only drawback is it that if you have a large front door on a historic house it won't be long enough. Someone posted on here about the tubes not fitting into the sleeves you just have to have a little patience and puff out the sleeve before putting in the tubes it's not a problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: jude

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Out Annoying Daft, Dust, n Bugs!
customer_reviews.text: Great product!~ Because of my inside door connection leading to another room, it does the job well! The door has a wider space from the door to the floor. This product helps to keep out a flowing draft, dust and bugs that could pass thru below. You just cut off the tube of what you don't need, depending on the width of your door, n slide on!~👍 Works well as can be!👌
customer_reviews.author: S. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Kinda works
customer_reviews.text: Got this to stop cold air draft from under our closet door. It kinda works. Blocks most of the cold air, but you can still feel air pouring in at the end. It’s better than it was, but not as great as they make it seem. Was very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Wadd

customer_reviews.title: Jumbo is the way to go
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing something similar at the hardware store (and returning it), these are a much better product. The fact that the foam rollers are jumbo, makes all the difference. The smaller/regular version that I first purchased kept slipping under the bottom edge of the door & getting stuck whenever it was opened and closed. These stay put and don’t shift around. So glad I bought the 2-pack.
customer_reviews.author: AJD

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my room nice and toasty
customer_reviews.text: These are so great to keep your room at the ideal temperature. I have it installed on my bathroom door where a lot of cold air seeps in during winter. After installation, my room is definitely warmer which would ultimately save some heating bills too. They are definitely longer than your normal sized room doors, so I would recommend you to cut them a few millimeters longer than your measurement. The foam will still allow the slightly longer stopper to completely seal your door.
customer_reviews.author: Sang Jin Lee

customer_reviews.title: Measure !!!
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't big enough. I didn't see any dimensions on what size gap it would fit, reading the reviews I thought and figured since it was jumbo it would easily fit the gap. Nope.
customer_reviews.author: Helly

customer_reviews.title: Out Damn Mouse and Draft
customer_reviews.text: I had quite a gap at the bottom of my apartment door and I think that's how this darn mouse got into my apartment! Not to mention, there was always a cold draft coming through the door, which made my electric bill high. I got this and love it. No mouse, no cold draft. Also, a few other tenants in my building have the same stopper. So this must be the one to get!
customer_reviews.author: Master P.

customer_reviews.title: WORKS VERY WELL- BUT READ THIS TIP...
customer_reviews.text: Works quite well for my door & it’s what I expected! HERE IS A HELPFUL TIP...after being unable to get all the tubes shoved in the sleeve-I sprayed the remaining tubes lightly with non-stick cooking spray & they went right in. Wish I figured that out 15 minutes prior!
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Good luck with the assembly.
customer_reviews.text: To save money on shipping, this product comes to you ‘some assembly require’. Doesn’t seem like a big deal right? Until you try sliding 3 pieces of styrofoam thru a tunnel that’s too tight... twice (both sides). Additionally the stitched seams are coming apart straight out of the box. Why is it so hard to find quality products anymore?
customer_reviews.author: Christopher E. Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work properly
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t work for wide gaps. I bought 5 of them & now I’m stuck with 4 because they aren’t for 1 3/4 inch gaps like mine are. The one door that it is working is a 1 1/2 inch gap. So if your door has a wider gap than 1 1/2 inches it won’t work. Don’t even bother trying. You’re going to waste your money. Unfortunately I was setting up a house I just moved into, put them in a closet & forgot about them. Now I’m stuck with em.. Smh
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Z.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pest control
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to prevent mice from going through the door. Trying to fit this in my door was a little bit of a pain. It slides out all the time when I open and close, but... It works for keeping little pests out. One tried hard going through by chewing the hell out of it but it didn't work! It's surprisingly durable. Then my electric zapper did the rest of the job and I don't have a pest problem anymore. It's a hell of a lot cheaper than those metal door covers advertised for pest control and it's easier to install because all you need are scissors and possibly tape.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: It's terrible. Pieces of styrofoam you fit together and still in the brown thing under the door. Fabulous but only one side fits. I have spent too much time trying to get the styrofoam to fit in a hole too small..its ripping.
customer_reviews.author: bettylou

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase
customer_reviews.text: We have a large gap under our apartment door and had been using an old fleece towel to stop the wind with mixed results. Bought this and with a slight trim to the outer facing foam we were good to go. The wind no longer comes underneath and the whole thing just slides with the door problem free. My neighbor cooks heavy with garlic (and i'm Italian!) and i never smell those cooking smells anymore. This was an unexpected bonus. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: jjackjflash

customer_reviews.title: CAN'T BEAT IT FOR THE PRICE!
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely satisfied with this draft stopper. I live in an apartment building. Under the front door there is a gap, allowing insects and noise into my apartment. This product is super easy to assemble, very universal - I had no issues with it fitting my 36' door - PERFECTLY. No more flies and much less noise!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lucas_M.

customer_reviews.title: Just Okay
customer_reviews.text: I have used these draft stoppers in the past, made by a different company, and they were great and easy to use. These are just okay - the material is kind of flimsy and you have to cut the styrofoam and cover to fit your door. Sounds easy - but it did not cut very smoothly, so it took a lot of work to make it look better - and it still an eye sore. Not that impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Sanndy Beaches

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, but...
customer_reviews.text: If you're expecting magic, you're mistaken. If this will be placed where there's a floor it can slide on, it will work well. It may not (I don't know) on a carpeted floor. I'm delighted with it, but it sometimes has to be adjusted. When the door is closed, it seals the bottom fairly well. I'm thinking of getting another one.
customer_reviews.author: ESM

customer_reviews.title: These draft dodgers are awful. They keep bunching up ...
customer_reviews.text: These draft dodgers are awful. They keep bunching up under the door upon opening and closing the door [we have wood floors], so we have to either bend over to pull one side as we close the door, or use our foot. They are VERY difficult to get the filler roll in the casings as well. I found by trimming the end that goes in first to a modified cone shape helped.They do, however help keep drafts to a minimum - just not worth the effort or cost.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Terrible and not sewn together
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. It’s not even sewn together so it won’t work. Can’t even use it and now it’s too late for a return.
customer_reviews.author: HC777

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: I ended up buying some cheaper ones at Walmart. They worked so much better than yours. Yours get stiff and the inside keeps coming out.
customer_reviews.author: sue thomas

customer_reviews.title: So Easy
customer_reviews.text: I love having that block the outside air; it does not get in the way. However, it was too wide for my door and the foam had to keep getting kicked back inside. The outer vinyl slipped and refused to stay put even with taping it to the door. After three months the vinyl ripped when my door got stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It's worth the money and so easy to install. It does what is supposed to do. My door had gaps and this fills in the space. It blocks bugs from trying to get inside my house. It helps keep my living room cooler when I am using my air conditioner. It's not ugly and it's well made. I was pleasently surprised. I will be buying more in the future for the rest of my doors in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy James

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Works well for blocking draft. Slides around a little when we open and close our front door. So, we take our foot and push it back into place. Still, would recommend. Like that we can wipe it down. Had to cut the length of the styrofoam down a little, then fold the vinyl ends in a little for an optimum fit for our front door.
customer_reviews.author: Lana W.

customer_reviews.title: don't buy it!!!
customer_reviews.text: don't know how it works because the assembly is impossible. the foam tubes are impossible to slide in. Uneven stitching on one side midway down. Cannot get past it. I even sprayed it with WD40 and applied oil. Still won't slide in. I'm sending it back
customer_reviews.author: SANDY NOTA

customer_reviews.title: Study door draft guard
customer_reviews.text: I have a window in my closet so my closet door creeps open often letting the cold air in. This door draft guard is better than what I expected. The sleeve is made from a study pleather/pvc type of material and the foam inserts are very firm. This not only shields the cold draft coming from my closet but it also keeps my door shut because of the lack of pressure from the draft. Great investment!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Pichardo

customer_reviews.title: Helped reduced high electricity bill
customer_reviews.text: For years, the area by my front door was extremely cold which was affecting the heating in the hallway. I'm not sure why it took so long but once I added this to my front door its a significant difference to the point I don't have to put towels or blankets to try to keep the cold air from coming inside. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to assemble & install.
customer_reviews.text: Fits my door perfectly, was easy to assemble & install. I live in an apartment & there was quite a gap between the bottom of my door & the floor which let cold air in from the hallway last winter. This works perfectly to block the draft. I highly recommend this item for anyone needing a quick easy way to weatherize their doors.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M Russell

customer_reviews.title: Evelots does it again
customer_reviews.text: A great design and simple installation. This has helped a lot with regulating the temperature in our home, as with Evelots' other magnetic design with we use for another door. Great buy. When we move to a place with more external doors we'll likely get more.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew G.

customer_reviews.title: It slides out of place too much.
customer_reviews.text: If you could include heavy duty self adhesive velcro strips, it would be better. It needs to be held in place after install.
customer_reviews.author: Monika

customer_reviews.title: No match for 20# cat!
customer_reviews.text: This product is fine and I liked it. I bought it because my newest rescue wasn't fully integrated with my others yet and he would keep me up all night meowing. I hoped that this would help the noise level a bit, but he had it torn to shreds in less than an hour. He's a 20 lb. Maine Coon mix.
customer_reviews.author: Sammigirl

customer_reviews.title: Super easy install
customer_reviews.text: I got the brown "leather look" material, matches my doors. Slides smoothly across my carpet. Never bunches up or makes door stick while opening or closing. I did add a piece of double stick tape under door to keep stopper from sliding out. Overall great buy! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Not affective
customer_reviews.text: I got this for an inside door that will go over linoleum flooring in my kitchen. Well the first couple openings and closings ...the door it worked nice but now it sticks somewhere on the door when opening and then the door jams and won’t move. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: it does the job
customer_reviews.text: It does keep the outside air from coming in, and the inside heat from seeping out. BUT, every time we open the door, it slides to one side, and sometimes I have to struggle with it a bit to get it to slide back into the door to allow the door to close properly. That part a bit annoying, but once the door is shut, you'll golden.
customer_reviews.author: Ashraf A. Dawod

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: The seams on this were crocked, so I had a difficult time inserting the foam cylinders. I didn't want to return it, so I had to really work hard to get them in on one of the sides. It's also quite a bit wider than the door thickness, so I'll have to adjust that eventually. I like though.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it.
customer_reviews.text: Foam does not fit in one of the sleeves all the way without major greasing or hearing of the vinyl. Also had to cut mine down to size which takes the nice end stitching away. Hated the white ends showing. Throwing this in trash and getting something that is more easy on the eye.
customer_reviews.author: LA DDR

customer_reviews.title: Another defective one.
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, the foam tubes do not fit into the stitched vinyl slots because they are too narrow for the foam. Useless, and will return. Very cheaply made product.
customer_reviews.author: cone gobbler

customer_reviews.title: Slips around a little but easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Product came pretty fast, was really easy to put together. I live next to a very loud, busy road and I didn't notice a great reduction in noise but I mainly needed the draft under the door to block weather and the occasional bug.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! Affordable and easy to install solution to cancel out noise in our daughters room. Her room is right off of the living room and I had some trouble with her waking up when her cousins were here playing. Hasn’t happened since we got this product.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and the gap is too big.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep my dog from scraping her nose up when she's in the bathroom. She tries to squeeze her little butt under the doorway. I thought this would help but she ripped it to shreds the first day. This review may not be fair since I wasn't using it for it's intended purpose but it's still flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Veal

customer_reviews.title: It really works!
customer_reviews.text: This draft dodger was used on an outside door that isn't air tight. I thought it might be difficult to attach it on the door, but it was easy. This was in winter and that constant cold draft stopped immediately. Yea!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and noisy
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't fit snuggly on the door, is made of vinyl which is noisy when it slides across the floor, and it's appearance is cheap.
customer_reviews.author: SoDak

customer_reviews.title: They kept out the draft
customer_reviews.text: They kept the draft out perfectly, they slide a bit upon opening and cloing the door sometimes gettinv in the way. They only survied one season. They were worth it , the heating cost we saves alone covered them
customer_reviews.author: Chika-dee WheldN

customer_reviews.title: Cover Split in less than a month, not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: It does block the airflow under my door. However, I had purchased a similar product on Ebay for about $3. It lasted nearly a year before it fell apart. This one barely made it a month before it split. I had envisioned vinyl lasting longer. I'm really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kerrip

customer_reviews.title: Only works for thick doors?
customer_reviews.text: I returned this door stopper because it was too large or my door was too thin. I had a standard door, but the length of material in between the two foam cylinders was too long. This let air and sound come through very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Bobert

customer_reviews.title: What was I thinking?
customer_reviews.text: When this type of product 1st came out I thought how cool. Decades later and I have a door with a 2 high opening at the bottom, letting cold in from the laundry room. had no idea this was a poorly made as it is, doesn't fit the height of the opening and keeps having to be pushed back into place after the door opens and closes. who has doors that thick?
customer_reviews.author: nathan holloway

customer_reviews.title: Good, but be aware it is plastic.
customer_reviews.text: I had one with fabric before and that is why I bought it. But I did not my homework and did not notice this one is made with plastic and it slides everytime I move the door. I had to nail them to keep in position.
customer_reviews.author: juan

customer_reviews.title: Big Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: Threw it away the first day- it does not hold to the door at all! Useless!
customer_reviews.author: Karen L

customer_reviews.title: This isn't super well made
customer_reviews.text: This isn't super well made; as others have said it is VERY difficult to insert the foam into some of the tubes. It appears we got lucky and after MUCH pushing and twisting got all 4 of ours in. Now that it's assembled it does a great job and is large enough to cover the whole length of our door. It is also able to be cut to size, though I'd worry about how well it would hold up after being cut. Overall it's working well for us but required patience and persistence to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and doesn’t work unless there is no threshold
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with entry door with threshold. Flimsy junk.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my door from family room to garage that has a big gap under it. The cold air blows in under it all winter. This product was real easy to put together and blocks all the draft. It glides over the throw rug and wood floor without moving so its easy to open and close the door
customer_reviews.author: Emily Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Not for bedroom doors.
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for this. Someone I live with smokes in their room. Thought this would keep the scent out of the whole apt but the fabric gap is too wide so the air flows through. I guess it’s not ideal for bedroom doors since they’re not very thick.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: slides well
customer_reviews.text: This one is fairly easy to assemble and it Slides well. However, it slipped toward the door opening, which kept the door from closing, so elastic at the hinge end would have been helpful to keep the rolls secured from slipping out. I used some thread the width of the door on the hinge end to keep them in place.
customer_reviews.author: Ferndaly

customer_reviews.title: luckily my door is the correct fit for this life ...
customer_reviews.text: luckily my door is the correct fit for this life saver. Certainly you have to customize and make the most of it. I stuffed pieces of cloth to make sure it made a tight seal without hindering the door movement. It worked.... so I have already ordered few for the parents!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Azzo

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This is jumbo the door had about 1.5 gap and this draft stopper sealed it right up and the door stays in the middle of the stopper! Was just a few cm too long just cut it off. No issues. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: tunwewec

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: These door stoppers are fantastic. Easy to fit size of door and they block the cold air from coming under the door. It has made an incredible difference - no drafts. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Grams

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: We had the threshold replaced which resulted in a gap between it and the bottom of our apartment door. The Draft Stopper arrived before the temperature dropped to minus zero. After some measuring and cutting, it slid under the door and did a great job of keeping the warm air from escaping and will also do a great job of keeping us cool in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Dominguez

customer_reviews.title: Effective product.
customer_reviews.text: I put these on my French doors that are not that great with insulation,the door is much easier to open with these as opposed to the Velcro ones ,against high pile carpet
customer_reviews.author: C. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: I love the jumbo size bolsters on either side that cover ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the jumbo size bolsters on either side that cover a large gap well. The stitching like many others mentioned was uneven and getting the foam into them took a big of effort that I feel could have been easily avoided with a straight stitch. I also am not sure why if this is set to fit a standard size door (which mine is) that I would have to cut it to fit. If you cut it you are left with an unsightly edge vs. the sewn edge it comes with.
customer_reviews.author: Celestia

customer_reviews.title: Its a solid buy.
customer_reviews.text: Its not the absolute best solution but I knew that going in. It will keep the drafts out and will keep some of the noise out as well. However, it makes opening doors just a tiny bit tedious.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product!!!
customer_reviews.text: This under-the-door draft blocker slides easily into place and no cold air or dust can blow into my apartment. I wish I had bought this years ago. It looks very nice and the door opens and closes about the same. In the front of the door there is a metal strip which does not interfere with how the door closes with this blocker under the door. Ten stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: Beauty queen

customer_reviews.title: Stays under door
customer_reviews.text: Door was shorter but cut to fit, the over sized foam is great and doesn't get stuck under door like the Ducktape version. Put the cut part facing wall to keep it looking nice. Easy.
customer_reviews.author: zeroride21

customer_reviews.title: Evelots Draft Stopper Door
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking, easy to assemble and to install. However, it's a bit lose and moves back and forward under my front door, so it has to be push back when closing door.
customer_reviews.author: M. C. Perez

customer_reviews.title: Too bulky
customer_reviews.text: Product was very bulky and wouldn’t allow door to be closed with screen door or original placement of strips across the threshold even with screen door wide open and out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: MRSFFRENCH

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money, doesn't work and forget about trying to open your door. It's a great concept but needs improvement. If it's a back door you never open itll it'll work but if you open the door alot don't get it. Sorry just being honest
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not for me.
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to install. Just fallow the instructions. After installing, the product kept getting caught/wedged under my door making it hard to open and close. I have about a half inch gap between the bottom of my door and the floor and the tubes are about an inch thick. Needless to say if the gap was smaller than it might have worked better and might not have been a hindrance.
customer_reviews.author: NSue

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be made for a thick door
customer_reviews.text: This draft stopper is fairly as described but if you cut it to size you should probably sew it as there is but one thread holding it together. Also the space between tubes is about 2.5-3inches
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. Good idea, bad execution. It doesn’t stay in place, so it becomes more of nuisance/hindrance than a help. It’s cheap and is ruins within days because it moves so much. I have had it installed less than a week and it was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: ChristineP

customer_reviews.title: It Works Great/Very neat Look
customer_reviews.text: This stops the air from coming from underneath the door without using weather stripping which would be difficult under the door. A must buy; OH it does slide forward occasionally when you open the door easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: Black Panther

customer_reviews.title: Did the job!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this product for the bottom and top of one of our doors. Unfortunately, we failed to noticed the low overhang of our door on the outside so it wouldn't work on top. But the bottom was perfect! Stopped the usual draft we have. It was super easy to install and put together. It was even easy to adjust the size! So as far as I'm concerned, it did exactly what it was supposed to!
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Works as shown
customer_reviews.text: There is some minor assembly but so far the stopper has worked as described keeping not only the drafts out of our apartment but dust and pet hair that sometimes blow in under the door from the apartment hallway.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Prescott

customer_reviews.title: WASTE MONEY, IT DOES NOT SEVE.
customer_reviews.text: IT DOES NOT SERVE, WITH THE OPENING AND CLOSING OF THE DOOR, THE LEATHER IS CRUMPLED AND THE INTERIOR OF TELGOPOR IS DRAWN AND RUNS OUT OF WHERE ALL THE GARBAGE IN THE STREET PASSES THROUGH THE SIDE.
customer_reviews.author: miriam amendolaro

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Have used this type of product previously but have dog that sometimes wets by the door and the cloth items would get wet and have to be thrown, trying this one assume any wetness will just wipe off.
customer_reviews.author: D. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great quality material
customer_reviews.text: Great quality material. Only draft guard I've found that will work with our awkward sunroom doors that have about 1" of clearance between the floor and bottom
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Pretty worthless
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I was excited with how easy it was to put together and trim to size, but when I tried to put it under the door it kept getting stuck under the door when I would open or close. Got to the point I tried to staple so of the excess holder to my door, which worked for a day but then it went back to getting stuck and started ripping the casing. Maybe it's just my door is an odd shape or too elevated but for me this was a wasted purchase and I would not recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Grim

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install... however the only thing I would suggest as a product improvement is to be able to seal the ends closed so the white parts are not visible. I'm sure someone with sewing skills can do this with any extra pieces that re cut off but not everyone knows how to sew.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: They do Work
customer_reviews.text: We have a set of double doors in our dining room that always let cold air in. I decided to but these and give them a try. They do help with the cold air that was getting in under our doors. I even unlocked my stationary door and put one underneath to keep the air out.
customer_reviews.author: Micole Copas

product_meta.title: Evelots Draft Stopper Door/Window-Double-No Repositioning-No Cold/Dust-36 Inch
feature_bullets: Evelots jumbo draft stopper conveniently moves with your door - no need to constantly bend down to re-position! It has a vinyl cover which is easy to cut to length and very easy to clean. Double Sided = Double Protection! Also great for blocking noise and fumes.
Draft stopper glides over carpet, wood, tile, linoleum and more to easily move with the door.

Fits doors up to 36 inches length . Foam tubes and vinyl can be cut down to fit narrow doors. Jumbo 2-inch diameter foam tubes are perfect for blocking extra-large gaps under your door. Can be used for your front door, back door, garage entry door, bedroom door, bathroom door, etc...

Cut draft stopper to size for windows to help prevent drafts and seal in hot or cold air. Flexible material allows for the draft stopper to form fit to your windows. Sold successfully on Amazon for 3 years.
Trusted vendor from Vermont. For years Evelots has provided unique products with a 30 day easy return policy, and 100% satisfaction guarantee.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars2,173 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
